thread.title: Suspected impaired driver on loose after crashes, carjacking Vancouver
thread.title_full: Suspected impaired driver on loose after crashes, carjacking | CTV Vancouver News

author: CTV Vancouver
title: Suspected impaired driver on loose after crashes, carjacking Vancouver
text:
Coquitlam Mounties are searching for a suspected impaired driver who allegedly crashed a pickup truck then carjacked and crashed another vehicle while fleeing from officers Thursday. 
The RCMP said it received reports of an impaired driver in a parking lot near the Superstore on Lougheed Highway around 10:30 a.m.
When officers arrived, the driver took off, allegedly hitting another car in the parking lot on the way out.
Mounties said the suspect eventually crashed the pickup at the railway tracks near Westood Street and Kingsway Avenue, then got out and carjacked a Toyota Corolla.
The Corolla was crashed into a hydro pole moments later, but the driver ran off on foot, according to the RCMP. Officers are continuing to search the area.
Mounties said it doesnâ€™t appear anyone was seriously injured in any of the crashes, but the victims were shaken up.
